alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Several clusters of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the southern City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 615 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of thunderstorms centered along a line extending from 13 miles east of Norfolk International to near Bowers Hill. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 to 40 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locally heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach around 515 PM EDT. Downtown Portsmouth around 520 PM EDT. Regent University around 535 PM EDT. Kempsville and Fentress around 540 PM EDT. Princess Anne around 555 PM EDT. Back Bay around 600 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Herberts Corner, Oceana NAS and Macons Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
